event.title: was renamed as George Town in 1911

data.event: The name of this area 'Black Town' was renamed as George Town in 1911 in honour of King George V when he was crowned as the Emperor of India.

In 1639, when Francis Day was looking for somewhere to build a fortified warehouse for the English East India Company, he soon acquired the land where, in 1640, he built the compound named Fort St George.
